tossup_question: 12) CHEMISTRY  Why does fluorine have a smaller atomic radius than carbon?
tossup_MCQoptions:
W) Fluorine is more electronegative than carbon
X) Halogens have a larger atomic radius than carbon
Y) Fluorine has more charged particles attracting the electron cloud to the nucleus
Z) Fluorine is the most electronegative element
tossup_answer: ANSWER: Y) Fluorine has more charged particles attracting the electron cloud to the nucleus
bonus_question: 12) CHEMISTRY  Why does fluorine have a smaller atomic radius than carbon?
